titlepage.titleproper: Smith Centennial Study Oral History Project, 1970-1975
titlepage.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlepage.author: Gayla Spaulding
titlepage.sponsor: Encoding funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Smith Centennial Study Oral History Project
did.abstract: The Smith Centennial Study was a an oral history project for Smith College's centennial celebration. The project culminated with the publication of the book, College: A Smith Mosaic. The purpose of the study was to provide a source of information about the importance of education in women's lives. Smith alumnae were interviewed, their observations were recorded on tape and the tapes were transcribed. The collection includes clippings, reports to the National Endowment for the Humanities, transcripts and correspondence with participants in the study, general correspondence, annotated and published copies of the book, College: A Smith Mosaic.

bioghist.p: The Smith Centennial Study, funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities, was a project that President Mendenhall asked Jacqueline Van Voris to undertake in 1970 as an oral history project for Smith College's centennial celebration. Ms. Van Voris dedicated over four years to the project, which culminated with the publication of the book, College: A Smith Mosaic, which she submitted as partial fulfillment of requirements for her MA in Education in 1975. The purpose of the study was to provide a source of information about the importance of education in women's lives. Smith alumnae were interviewed, their observations were recorded on tape and the tapes were transcribed. The interviews were informal conversations conducted in a manner designed to extract pertinent information. The questions were designed to stimulate conversation and to keep the focus on the respondent. Phrasing of the questions encouraged the respondent's frank appraisal of her education. Questions typically asked included: "Why did you decide to go to Smith? Was it your idea? What was your academic preparation? What courses did you study? What are your remembrances of Smith? What is your general assessment of the education you received? How could college have helped you more? Have your views on education changed over the years since your graduation? Have you ever felt discriminated against because you are a woman?"

The interviews were conducted and recorded from 1971-74. The book, College: A Smith Mosaic, was published in February, 1975 and lists of respondents were sent to the Directory of Oral History Collections for inclusion in that directory.

scopecontent.p: The Smith Centennial Study Oral History Project collection is comprised of news clippings, reports to the National Endowment for the Humanities, transcripts and correspondence with participants in the study, general correspondence, annotated and published copies of the book, College: A Smith Mosaic, interview statistics and transcript excerpts by subject.

arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series:

item.ref: II. Transcripts and Correspondence with Participants

userestrict.p: The Archives has no information on the status of literary rights in the collection and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright. Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the papers must be requested from the College Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Smith Centennial Study Oral History Project, Box #, Smith College Archives.

scopecontent.p: This series contains six boxes of background information on the genesis and history of the project including an alphabetical list of participants in the project, notes, memoranda, interview suggestions, information on trips taken to interview respondents, the book prospectus, instructions to transcribers, reports, proposals and general correspondence.

did.unittitle: Alphabetical list of participants in study and College 1970s
Genesis and history of the study 1975/Jan/31
Appendix A: The beginning of the study,notes and memoranda 1971
Appendix E: Study statement and suggested questions 1973
Appendix F: File guide for clipping transcripts 1973
Appendix J: Book introduction, notes,references, original typescript 1974
Appendix L: Notes on quoting and suggested citation form 1974
Appendix M: Study statement for prospective respondents 1971-73
Appendix O: Preface, samples of restriction forms 1971-74
Appendix P: Example of edited page corrected by respondent undated
Friends of the Library project announcement 1970
National Endowment for the Humanities grant: application, budget reports and correspondence 1971-72
National Endowment for the Humanities grant: application, budget reports and correspondence 1973-74
Report of respondents for Oral History Directory, interview list 1973/Jul/12
List of respondents used in book with late changes undated
Hardcover copy of College: A Smith Mosaic 1975
SERIES II. TRANSCRIPTS AND CORRESPONDENCE WITHPARTICIPANTS.

scopecontent.p: This series consists of twelve boxes of correspondence and transcripts with and by the interview respondents. These are filed alphabetically.

did.unittitle: SERIES III. TRANSCRIPT EXCERPTS BY SUBJECT.

scopecontent.p: This series consists of six boxes of transcript excerpts by subject. Subjects include activities, Alumnae Association, coeducation, curriculum, financing college, minority group reactions, people, places, rules, social mores, social work, vocations, volunteerism and women's education to name some. These are also filed alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Board of Trustees and other college committees undated
Events brought to the college undated
Special projects at Smith: Institute for the Coordination of Women's Interests and Council of Industrial Studies undated

scopecontent.p: This series consists of cassette recording of participant interviews.
